wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Edmund Colquhoun Pery, 5th Earl of Limerick  (16 October 1888 – 4 August 1967) was a British peer and soldier.

response: Lord Limerick was twice married. He married firstly his cousin, Caroline Maria, daughter of Reverend Henry Gray, on 28 August 1862. They had one child, William Pery, 4th Earl of Limerick. Caroline died on 24 January 1877. Limerick married secondly Isabella, daughter of James Charles Henry Colquhoun, on 20 October 1877. They had several children, including Edmund Pery, 5th Earl of Limerick.

Pery was the son of Edmund Pery, 5th Earl of Limerick and Angela Pery.The Earl of Limerick, Daily Telegraph, 14 January 2003, Retrieved 4 Feb 2017 Pery was educated at Eton College and New College, Oxford. As he left Oxford his father told him "You have unfortunately been born with a prefix to your name, and unless you get an equivalent number of suffixes people will assume you are a fool". So among other things he became a chartered accountant. Pat Limerick was a noted athlete and he skied for the House of Lords against the House of Commons.
